Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: Gaz1965
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in a peaceful quiet area with easy access to tourist and business areas via train or taxi. Very friendly staff and relaxing lounges. The superior rooms are very generous and well equipped. A very pleasant experience. Gary Blake UK

Reviews.Title: “Richard Biber. England”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and well appointed accommodation. It is nice to relax in the quiet rooms. The Hotel is out of the main urban area but close enough to access all areas via train or taxi. The internet lounge is very useful. Bar and restaurant are well stocked.The hotel lobby has a vibrant yet relaxed atmosphere and hosts a small and friendly shop for electrical or curiosity items. Fully recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with very good service and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PetmagMalmo_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Very good service and friendly staff. Two elevators. Cashdispenser. Small but clean room. Few rooms with balcony. The restaurant can be very crowded at breakfast.Breakfast ok. Nice bar with happy hour. Beer expensive. The poolarea is in shade from two pm but its ok to use the pool and gym at Park hotel close to Arabian Park. Free bus twice a day to shoppingmall and beach. Taxi cheap. The location is in the outskirt but close to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rico3625
Reviews.Content: The room was okay,a little on the small size. no bath,but shower was great.I found the staff service average,room for improvement,in service.Location was a quite distance from places of interest,they do run a shuttle bus during the day,to several places,taxis are very cheap.I found the hotel pool small,always busy,so a tip go next door to the apartments which is the same group,use there pool,lesws people there,changing rooms alot nicer.... overall positive stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley0099
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel through Octopus.com. It is close to the airport and Dubai mall and they offer a complimentary shuttle service at certain times of the day to the mall, the airport and some other destinations. The room is clean. The gym is tiny and I notice the treadmill is out of order and the pool was very busy. Very mutlicultural hotel, I heard languages I had never heard before. I was in Dubai overnight for my birthday and was by myself, they even delivered me a wine and a small cheesecake. Very impressed! It is not luxury but if your on a budget and can not afford the full glitz and glamour of Dubai I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RAJU S
Reviews.Content: Arabian Park provided me and my team a fantastic stay for Gulf Food Show. It is a great value for money,clean and neat surroundings, excellent staffs and well maintained property. As they state, it gives you silent nights to sleep compare to other hotels with heavy sound at nights from various outlets. We are pleased to recomend this property for any DBX travellers. RAJU SEBASTIAN MIH Regional Manager Rezayat Catering Saudi Arabis

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in bur dubai.”
Reviews.Author: Rosi065
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Dubai, The hotel was ok. We had breakfast included. The pool was in the shade which meant that we never used it. Service wasn't that good. But they had good shuttle bus service to some of the shopping malls and also to the jumeriah beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: AlecCampbell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably just right for a stoppover of 3 days or so. Its clean and well maintained if the rooms are a little dated by Dubai standards but for the money you can't complain. Yes it is a bit remote and you have to take a cab everywhere or the courtesy bus (although it was never running at the times we needed it). A taxi to Dubai Mall only costs around £3.00 and Emirates Mall £8.00. Breakfast is palatial though and good quality although I would personally avoid the 9am rush when the restaurant becomes a bit of an assault course lol. Corridors in the hotel smelt a bit smokey but never saw anyone smoking which was odd! Overall perfectly adequate for a stoppover but probably no for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “clear hotel”
Reviews.Author: olgacom7
Reviews.Content: good for business and for resort, near to beach, nice experience, recommended for all who want to feel good in the hight

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TJM566
Reviews.Content: What can I say, from the moment we arrived at the Arabian Park Hotel we had nothing but great friendly service. Rooms were well maintained, breakfast was incredible truly even if I tried I could no fault this hotel. Even though the hotel is not close to the main stream of the city there is nothing like shuttles provided by the hotel to get you back and forth. Taxis were also reasonable but make sure you familiarize yourself but going a few times with the shuttle bus. Thanx to the Wafi Mall for the holiday entertainment on the Pyramid. Dubai Mall.............. I have no words for this place. I guess i will have to go back to experience more.Thanx to the UAE had a wonderful three days!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BandM67
Reviews.Content: The Arabian Park hotel was pleasant, with smallish rooms, lovely cotton duvet and pillow covers, a big bed. The deco was...ahem. The staff were rushed but pleasant (I would say that the hotel was quite understaffed!) The breakfast buffet was yummy! The hotel had three issues...the first was the bed, which was large but amazingly lump. Not just your average, dumpling-like lumps, either...I'm talking about springs poking through the mattress! Second, the website implied that internet was free in guest rooms but the only place for free internet was in a lounge, which of course necessitated going down to the lounge which was usually crowded with people loudly skype-ing far-away friends. This brings me to the second issue--other hotel guests! Our fellow residents were shockingly rude, pushing in the breakfast buffet, smoking, yelling and swearing in the lounge areas. I suppose this is what one gets for being a budget traveler! All in all, the hotel was more than we expected but fellow travelers made it unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nellikaramelli
Reviews.Content: We spend two weeks there and we like it there. Me, hubby and teenaged daughter like the hotel. The studio was very comfortable. Rooms were very clean and tidy. I have never had such a nice and big bed in any other hotel. The staff were very nice, friendly and helpfull. Hotel had suprisingly fast internet. Only minus was the water of the pool; it was freezing. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “good bargain; will be better when metro stop opens”
Reviews.Author: uofmgrl80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good enough - the room was a decent size and the bathrooms were decently spacious. The location is a bummer though - unless you have a car, you have to take a taxi everywhere. The metro stop that is close by wasn't open when we went so taxis were our only options. Getting one wasn't ever an issue, although once we were shuffled into an unmarked "taxi" that assured us that he had a meter, and when we got to our location we paid double what we would have paid, so watch out for that. The free shuttles were a nice break from taxis, so use them when you can. Most of the staff were really nice except for one front desk guy who was snarky when we asked some questions. The breakfast buffet is a madhouse, but no matter how busy they were, we were almost always seated pretty quickly. Lastly, you have to go to the 2nd floor to use the free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Enough for our money”
Reviews.Author: dominikblitz
Reviews.Content: The hotel surpassed our expectations in all respects. The beauty of the place, the comfortableness of the rooms and cleanliness represents excellent value for money all round. Stunning hotel which you wouldn’t be regret. Nice foods, friendly staff, and quality of the services. It made our vacation memorable. I recommend this hotel to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed A
Reviews.Content: Arabian Park is a nice 3 star hotel, but serves like any other 5 star hotel. The rooms are better than many 4 star and 5 star hotels in the city. Nice and comfortable beds, nice and varied breakfast and a decent lunch. The dinner is pretty good there. It is in a nice and quiet location with great views on all sides. From one side, you can see the Burj Khalifa from the balcony. Watching the sun set beside the world's tallest tower from the balcony without any obstruction of buildings is so beautiful. It's quite an experience. It has free and surprisingly very fast internet on the second floor lounge (you can get download speeds upto 2 Mbps, although I wouldn't recommend downloading, since its illegal). The nearest metro station is a 5 minute walk and you can get a cab pretty easily as they drive through all the time. In the off chance that you don't find one, you can get the staff to get you one. All in all, its a great hotel, has quite a good restaurant for its value and a nice pub with a view to the pool. Next time I'm in Dubai, I'm definitely going here. Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “"3 stars hotel with 5 stars attitude"”
Reviews.Author: Mila S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and located little bit far from the center, but there is a metro station near and WaFi centre. Most of all I liked breakfasts, as for 3 stars hotel they are really good, a lot of fruits, juces, meat..... Service in hotel is excelent, there are transfers to WaFi centre, Jumeira beach park, Burj Khalifa. Also they have business cener 24 hours open and a giude who can help you to choose any excursion and tell you everything about local customs if you visit Emirates at the first time. Rooms are clean and have everything you need. As for me it is really "3 stars hotel with 5 stars attitude" (written in hotel's farewall letter )

Reviews.Title: “Just the FACTS”
Reviews.Author: cruisinbob
Reviews.Content: Arabian Park is a basic 3 star hotel with no frills. I landed a deal for a few days, however, I would not stay there again. The Good; Great service, the folks working the concierge desk are very helpful. The hotel room is average, FREE but somewhat sluggish internet in the 2nd floor lounge. The Bad; Location of the hotel is out in the middle of nowhere and I mean NOWHERE, nothing around and it is too far to walk to anywhere of significance. Hotel does offer a shuttle but it is only offered a few times per day and in the evening hailing a cab is a challenge. The closest Metro station is a 12(AED) cab fare about $4 +. The Ugly; the room bed/mattress is perhaps the worst I have ever slept on in my life, the hotel is not well insulated and is quite noisy. Overall; I recommend that if you are to visit Dubai you MUST stay at a hotel that is close to the Metro, traffic in the city is congested and riding the Metro is the simplest and cheapest way to get around. There are too many good deals in a good location vice AP.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Jameel_qwerty
Reviews.Content: It is my first stay in this hotel (24 to 28 Dec) that was recommended by the travel agent as the hotel I wanted was not available due to the Xmas season in Dubai where I was meeting with friends. Originally, I booked a standard room but after checking on the net I called the hotel directly and asked for upgrade to King Balcony Room and Ms. Imelda Ramos was very helpful in arranging that and providing further information, I paid the difference during my stay, thank you Imelda. I liked my stay at the hotel and found the staff to be nice and helpful. Although the hotel is not within waking distance from anywhere, it has very good free shuttle bus service to the Wafi, Dubai & CityCentre malls, to the beach and airport. It is also close by taxi to the main areas in Dubai. The hotel is part of the Wafi group thus allowed me to use the group facilities and mainly the Pharaohs' Club near Wafi mall. Thanks again Imelda, Jameel

Reviews.Title: “Good value for not to much money”
Reviews.Author: Mikay05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 10 minutes away from the airport, which makes it an excellent location if you have a stop over for 1-2 days to visit Dubai. The drawback is that it is located in the middle of nowhere, but there is a shuttel service which runs a couple of times a day to the city/beach. Also a metro station is opening next year (green line) not very far away from the hotel, and otherwise you can always take a taxi which is waiting outside the hotel. The staff at the reception was very friendly and although it was busy they had time to answer our questions patiently. Our hotel rooms was a bit small, but clean as well as the bathroom, however the latter was a bit out dated. Furthermore we could not open the windows (security reasons) and the view was not that great. The biggest problem we had was that the air-conditioning was turned on extremely high, so it was very cold during the night, even we turned of the airco. The breakfast was good with a high variety of bread, meat, fresh fruit and coffee/tea. Also the system that they reserve a certain amount of money on you credit card for food and drinks works really well. Because of this it's not necessary to have money with you all the time and when you're checking out it goes very quick. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends if they’re considering a (stop over) trip to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Vacation...”
Reviews.Author: Noha C
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel apartment, great hospitality and transportation facilities.. All these factors in addition to the clean environment and varied activities have combinated to deliver the perfect vacation to all the family members.. Arabian Park Hotel is definitely the place for an unforgettable vacation in Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Annabel Y
Reviews.Content: We caught the shuttle bus from the airport at 2.15am and were pleased to find the reception and coffee bar operating when we arrived at the hotel! The room was fine, airconditioning nice and quiet, shame the window didn't open. Next day I enjoyed a swim in the warm, shallowish saltwater pool, then we took the shuttle bus down to the Wafi Mall. We stayed 2 nights; enjoyed a few coffees from the deli/coffee bar but didn't have breakfast booked or take any other meals in the hotel. I couldn't get my computer connected to the LAN in the room, but the (chargeable) WiFi in the lounge along the corridor by the lifts worked fine. One of the best things, was that as there are so few hotels or in fact other buildings in this area yet, all the taxis we hired to get back from town knew the hotel and where to find it. We were caught out by getting an expensive hire car from the front of the hotel - make sure you get a metered taxi if your budget is tight. On our last day we were flying out late in the evening, so after checking out at midday we put our bags in the free safe room instead of paying for one of the options to keep our room for a few hours. Then we got the shuttle back to the airport. The staff were all friendly and efficient and the hotel spotlessly clean and all the facilities we used were as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Apartments next to Hotel - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arabian Park Hotel Apartments which are just next to the hotel. We stayed in the one bedroom apartment & our friends stayed in the 2 bedroom unit. The rooms are very spacious & modern. The units are fully equipped with kitchen/dishes, dishwasher, washing machine, DVD player - everything you could ever need! Even though there was only 2 of us, I loved having 2 bathrooms. Our room overlooked the pool area & having a balcony provided another seating option. There was no bar at Apartments but the one at the Hotel is just a quick minute walk. The price we paid to have such a nice, spacious place was incredible. As for our friends who came with 2 children the 2 bedroom was perfect so this property is definitely suitable for families as well. So the downsides - check in was quite slow - my room wasn't ready at 2pm so I left & came back at 5 pm & still had to wait another 20 mins for the room. Other friends that were travelling with us did not receive the rooms that they had reserved online. They were put into smaller rooms without much 'sympathy' from the front desk - this may have been do to it being Nat'l wkend/Rugby 7s (?). Don't bother with having breakfast downstairs as it is simply terrible (although the staff was cheerful)! You are better off to buy your own groceries & cook within your unit or just go out somewhere. The location is a bit off the beaten path & taxis can sometimes take a bit but overall it's close to Festival City & the airport and not much further to Dubai Mall. All things consider at this price & for the size of the rooms we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, but boring”
Reviews.Author: Knud M
Reviews.Content: Clean, quite and nice, but without anything special since the area is "empty". Only sun at the pool from 7 to 9 a clock during wintertime. Windows in the room can not be open and for that reason has not been cleaned outside for years, which take the pleasure from the possible view (only one side has a beautiful view). Nice free transfer to city, airport and beach. Agent in the lobby are sell tickets for desert safari to you with reduce price and tell you not to mention it for others, but in fact the price were nearly twice up.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Odion O
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel....good for the price. Only wish the rooms were slightly bigger. The bed is soft and lumpy! The AC works great. The complimentary breakfast is adequate. But what is with the runny scrambled eggs??? All in all, not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahChougle
Reviews.Content: This hotel though away from the busy life of Dubai is a very comfortable place. The hotel is close to Jadaf. Although cabs are available throughout the day, it is advisable to have a car for commuting from and to the hotel. There is ample free parking available. The pool is nice.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: disappointing . the furniture ,tv, etc all old and outdated. curtains not clean . beds in very poor condition. the hotel is very noisy and we did not get quiet night sleep. it is located in no where with no nearby resturants, shopping and we spent afortune on taxis. the shuttle bus is crowded as every one tries to use it. we truly will not recommend it to our friends and surly we will not use it again

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing to say the least !!! Terrible beds and dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HanaaH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Arabian Park hotel a few times before ( when it first opened and in 2009). I’m very disappointed by the state of the rooms currently. I first stayed in the standard room and then moved to the Superior Balcony Room. I suffered greatly while sleeping on the bed provided as the mattress was clearly worn out. It was very soft and sunk in middle of the mattress and you could tell the springs had given in. The bed sheets and cover were worn out and torn too. The room was dirty and dusty. Due to the Eid holidays all the hotels were full so I could not leave and go to another hotel and had to stay at Arabian Park and suffer every night waking up with a bad back and neck due to the matters. My mother’s room was also the same and another couple that we knew were suffering the same problem , so I knew complaining would be pointless at that point of time. The only good thing at the hotel was the food and that has maintained its quality. Arabian Park was always one of my favorite hotels due to its location and price but unfortunately I don’t see myself returning after my mother and I experiencing great pain in our backs and necks for 6 nights which totally destroyed our Eid holiday.

Reviews.Title: “My Business Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Victor289
Reviews.Content: Well theres lot to say about this hotel in Dubai which is situated in the Jadaf area just 10 mins away from the Airport but I will be only brief. Its staff and service is the best in line with a 5 star hotel though its a 3 star hotel. I would recommend this hotel to hundreds thousands and count goes on... Everything under one roof, swimming pool, gym, business centre, Restaurant, Mini Cafe and bar. Its the best hotel to stay whilst your trip in Dubai be it business or holidays... Best wishes, Victor Fernandes Kuwait

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: peachzlosangeles
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Dubai and will recommend to our friends. This is a busy hotel but the staff was friendly and helpful and took time to answer questions. Our room was clean and fresh as well as the rest of the hotel. There is free WiFi in the large lobbies on each floor as opposed to paying for it in your room. The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere but there is free scheduled shuttle service to wherever you need to go in Dubai including the airport. Also plenty of taxi service in front of the hotel. We did not find the location an inconvenience since we were able to utilize the hotels shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great.... Room not so”
Reviews.Author: Johnny B
Reviews.Content: Had I not booked through Expedia I would have left at check in and went someplace else. I can live with the isolated area as the hotel provides a free shuttle service. There is a bar, tiny gym, room service, restaurants, laundry, pool, free shuttle service and internet. These are amenities of much more expensive accommodations. The staff is friendly and very responsive to the minor issues I had at check in. Here's where it gets odd.... "Please be aware that food from outside is not allowed in the hotel..." REALLY?!?!?! This rule is actually in the Guest Directory and strictly adhered to by the front desk staff who are watching as you enter the building. Odder still... an empty mini bar that you pre pay in advance to fill with convenient "packages" starting at 25 Dhs for the Healthy Pack (fruit basket) to the 130 Dhs Gourmet Pack (2 bottles of wine, 2 candy bars, 2 packs of chips. Here's where it gets bad... the room... nothing special, just a room. Bed, desk, table, tv, water pot, trash can. There is NO carpeting in the room, you get cold tiles from the bathroom to the bed and everyplace in between. There is a 1/4 inch gap under the door causing you to HEAR EVERY conversation, foot step, cough, door open and close along with everything else that's going on outside. You may as well have the door open. Carpeting would help with that some in absorbing the noise also taking the echo and chill out of the room. The bed linen and bath towels could be of a higher quality. I purchased my own as the ones in the room didn't look really clean. There are better places to stay for roughly the same price. Do your research before committing to this hotel. While the hotel itself is above average, the quality of the room isn't at any price. Note to management: carpeting, a flat screen tv with premium cable, and better bed linen and bath towels would turn this establishment into an isolated gem!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Chigwell-85
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Dubai. It gives one a sense of space, both in and out. I loved sitting on my balcony with a glass of wine, gazing at the desert. I loved the space of my room with its separate dressing area and wall of closets. The clientele, at least the times I have stayed at the Arabian Park, are mainly business travelers like me. But there are also groups of young athletic types who are starting out on adventures. The three levels of dining work well; one can have a casual burger or sandwich in the cafe by the pool, a gourmet meal in the dining room, or pick up sandwiches, salads, and deserts from the newsagent. I think this hotel would be good for children, as they would pretty much have it to themselves all day, with the business people out on business and the young adventurers out adventure-ing. The pool is never crowded, and that staff are among the friendliest I have known; always ready to help and advise, never intruding. Service is excellent, check in and check out were very fast, and the hotel and its rooms are spotless. If you stay here, spend the [very little] extra for a superior room. I have not seen the standard rooms, although I heard from my colleagues that they are good. The superior rooms are great! The Arabian Park is very affordable. It is nice enough to be a vacation treat, but it leaves one with money left over for all that shopping one has to do. Speaking of which – ask the hotel about a trip to the Blue Souk in Shahjah. It’s about 30 minutes by taxi, and it’s more fun than you’ll find in the Dubai malls. Yes, the hotel is out of town. But there are always taxis out front, and it's a quick, inexpensive trip into the city. Wafi Mall is about 5 minutes away. I work in Dubai once a year on business and have stayed in several hotels. The Arabian Park is by far the best value, and a great experience as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but isolated”
Reviews.Author: Trevor93
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice for 2 nights each time, on the way to Kuala Lumpur to break the journey and on the return journey.The downside to this hotel is its remoteness, at least at present. The rear rooms overlook a vast empty space, part of which seems to be a building site and no doubt the whole area will be built upon eventually. The rear room which we were given on our second visit was also a little noisy with service vehicles, including waste water tankers, coming and going. The room we were given the first time, overlooking the outside swimming pool had a more pleasant aspect. The rooms were quite basic, but modern and perfectly acceptable.The hotel does offer a free shuttle service to the airport, which is good and also to the Wafi shopping centre, the beach etc. The shuttle times are limited however and in between a taxi is necessary. Be aware that the hotel taxis parked outside the hotel are more than twice as expensive as the local metered taxis. We were charged 26.50 UAE dirhams to the nearest metro station by the hotel taxi, but only 11.50 UAE dirhams coming back by a metered taxi. On our first stay the hot breakfast food selection was cold and not particularly nice. Breakfast was better on our second stay. It was warm but limited in choice. Egg wise, only scrambled is on display, but on our last morning we noticed the waiter bringing an omelette to a customer. Although there is no visible 'egg station', it seems that you can probably ask for boiled or fried eggs, but it would be a good idea for the hotel to advise customers of this. The staff were all very pleasant and polite. Overall the hotel is good value for money, especially for a flight stopover, spoilt only by its location.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: abujasim
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel with a swiming pool view. Room was nice, clean and good value for money. Hotel sevice and staff were good. I would recommend to stay there. I you don't have a car, it will be difficult for you to have a taxi since the hotel is away from taxi reach and you need to walk 2-3 minutes to reach the main hotel gate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Families...”
Reviews.Author: JamesnLizby
Reviews.Content: Arabian Park hotel does have apartments too, but it is just behind the Hyatt and therefore a good hotel with not a very bad location... the staff are very friendly and the services are very prompt.. The hotel offers free shuttle buses to the main malls and deira gold souk as well and therefore not much of a problem getting around.. Overall, my experience was good and really loved my stay in the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DURBAN62
Reviews.Content: Hi there, my wife and i stayed at Arabian Park Hotel on a stopover to another country, the staff were excellent, very helpful , friendly, and the plus was breakfast was nice :-) , The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to Burj Khalifa, Jumeirah Beach, Wafi Mall, Museum, and to the Airport, which was excellent, the hotel had a clean bedding and clean hotel, nice pool, the hotel is not near the town , but the free shuttle bus makes up for that. All in all a very good hotel to stay in, and not that expensive

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zed37
Reviews.Content: this is a very desirable and good family hotel, location is slightly out of the way if you want to go shopping however they do offer free shuttle buses to the main malls and deira gold souk as well. Once the jadaf metro station is opened this will be a brilliant place to stay. their staff are extremely polite and rooms are nice and clean. the bed is also nice and comfy. have to say the pool is only open till 9pm so you cannot have a dip at night when it gets too hot, maybe they need to keep it open till 12.00 also in the bathroom you get complimentary, soap, shampoo, sewing kit as well as sanitary bags but nothing for any males who forget their shaving cream.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with consistent values!”
Reviews.Author: WYSIWYG-WAZ
Reviews.Content: Having now visited the Arabian Park Hotel, Dubai on several occasions i feel it only right to review it again. Impressed on my first and subsequent visits to this hotel, staff are always friendly, well briefed to its service level and always smiling. Great value, good offers, and clean. A little out of the way but taxis are always available and well priced. Small enough to manage, big enough to care.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, has all the basics in place.. :)”
Reviews.Author: niraj84
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel with all the basics In place. I would highly recommend it to all those who are budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kragulj
Reviews.Content: A hotel with resonable prices and friendly stuff. It is conviently located half way between airport and city center. The hotel offers free bus ride to airport, WAFI shopping mall and Dubai beach at the fixed timetable. It houses small gym and outdoor swimming pool. Rooms are clean and nice. I would like to recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Reasonable Hotel with quite location”
Reviews.Author: mamq9
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is very good for the people who know Dubai very well. There is a shortage in the number of Reception staff .Restaurants are very expensive compare the level. Be Careful to take the rooms with Cemetary view. Very good value againe money

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - they try to make you as comfortable as possible”
Reviews.Author: Bibi217
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Ramadan this year (which was a big mistake - so hot and you can't drink in public) and the hotel was very comfortable and convenient. It is quite far from anything except the airport but you don't really notice this as they provide a shuttle to the main points of interest as well as the airport. The room was spotless and looked like it did in the professional photos on the hotel website. The food here is pricey compared to what you can get in town, but we couldn't complain about its quality. The WAFI mall is, in my opinion, not worth the bother - it's hard to navigate round and the prices are sky high. Even with the 30% off that the hotel vouchers give you, you still get a hefty bill in the restaurants. I would stay here again as we had a comfortable visit during the worst possible period in which to visit Dubai. All the hotel staff were very friendly, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mohi_Khater
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on Business trip. I was surprised to the location. Still the hotel is not far from the city attractions. However, you need to take Taxi to go anywhere. Not convenient to walk around the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Generally the hotel is clean and the stuff is helpful. Nice pool area and cozy bar. Good value of money. The hotel is suitable for quick business trips or for school/universities trips.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel but far away from evry were”
Reviews.Author: classic25
Reviews.Content: good hotel in general but u need car for any were u go its isolated even they arange free shutle from hotel to airport , mrket , beach

Reviews.Title: “Safe Clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: yhoza
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on my shopping visit in Dubai. It is situated in a central place and very close to City Centre as well as the popular sitghseeing places. They offered free shuttle to & from the airport as well as to Wafi Centre, a shopping centre close by. The Wafi centre is so expensive so stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a budget break”
Reviews.Author: sherbornemaz
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the adjoining Park Hotel Apartments where a friend actually lives in a serviced appartment. We had to use the Arabian Park pool as ours was being refurbished but unfortunately it is mostly in the shade which is not what you want in February. (probably ok in August!!) Location not brilliant but there is a shuttle bus to the Wafi which was good. Will be better when the nearby metro station is up and running.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money....”
Reviews.Author: JoanneMcDowell
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel, considering the price of some hotels in Dubai. The hotel is very modern and clean. The beds are large and very comfy and an excellent breakfast is provided in the morning. You need to use taxis to get to the main shopping areas, beaches etc but no matter where you stay in Dubai you will find you need a taxi at some time. Overall, a great little hotel - it is not a lavish luxurious hotel but it is more then adequate. I would say it is more like a European 4* star hotel rather than 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: roxannelowe
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, seemed like at least a 4 star. room was clean and very smart, trendy. Hotel very smart and modern, short trip from airport and to city. Great that they offer free shuttle service to airport and to mall and beach. Restuarant was awesome great food and great service. Hotel staff were friendly, helpfull, efficient and very welcoming. Price was great aswell. I loved my stay at the arabian park Hotel and will definately be back to stay on my next trip. Highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: sloppychops
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here 5 years ago paying a hefty £90, it was high season though. Now fast forward and returning for one night since we had to be up early for a flight it was amazing value coming in at £24!!!! This hotel certainly punches above its weight with good facilities including restaurant, pool, good size as well and a gym. One criticism is maybe the rooms and bathroom in particular are a bit small but we came from the Royal Meridien so maybe we are being a bit unfair. Also got two free drinks, beer, wine etc....when you combine that at £6 bottle of beer your staying for next to nothing. Lots of business travellers as expected being so close to the airport. There is also a shuttle that will take you to the airport and pick you up for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place for a stop over stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zeva2010
Reviews.Content: I was on route to Hong Kong with a five night stop over in Dubai and wanted somewhere cheap, clean and safe. Arabian Park Hotel ticked all the boxes! I stayed here solo over Easter break and while, yes, it is kinda in the middle of nowhere, it is not bad, as if you hop in the public taxis, it's fine. It's close to the airport too, which is handy. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to and from the hotel - though, the schedule on their website is SO out of date. I had to catch a taxi to the hotel when I first arrived and was told to get in a Pink Ladies cab - which worked out a bit more expensive (around 40-45 dirhams). The shuttle also offers services to a local shopping Mall (called Wafi) - the times are not great (average two hour wait), which isn't bad, but the mall is SO quiet!!! it is like a ghost town! I just went there and used the hotel vouchers to get 30% off the eateries at wafi. But if you didn't want to wait for the shuttle, there are taxis and the hotel is round the corner so wouldn't cost much I'd imagine. Check in was OK, front desk were friendly, but a bit slow in sorting out the paperwork. But they were really busy with lots of people checking in, so it's understandable. I stayed in the executive rooms - they were nice - it didn't look like the photos I saw, but it was fine. It was clean. The pool area is good too, the pool itself is small but it does the job. They have a few sun loungers and the life guards were always friendly and helpful. The hotel isn't far from Dubai Mall - when I caught a taxi from the mall to the hotel it was only about 20 dirhams. I visited Jumeriah Beach on the Monday - heading down there using the hotel shuttle (it is a bit of a trek so I'd definitely take the shuttle) - but note, the beach on Monday's is for women and children only, but men can still catch the shuttle down there. After the beach I had a late lunch at Burj al Arab - getting back to the hotel by catching the train/tube from Mall of Emirates to Dubai Mall (then taxi from the Dubai Mall to the hotel). The hotel staff were generally very friendly and helpful. As a solo traveller I was nervous about going to Dubai by myself, but it was fine! The hotel offered excursions and I signed up to a few and it was a blast!! I went on the day trip to Abu Dhabi - which was good, the price was great, but the places you visit were so so. But at least I can say I've been! I also did the evening desert trip - included sand bashing and dinner, belly dancing at the Desert Gate, a henna lady etc. This trip was also quite reasonable too! On the way back from Hong Kong, I decided to book again at the Arabian Park, just because of the convenience, price and because of my first positive stay there - I knew where everything was, how to get around and what to expect. I stayed here in May 2011 for a further two nights before returning to the UK. The prices are very reasonable, would be even better if shared, but because I travelled on my own it was OK - definitely worth booking an executive room because it includes internet access in the room, free canapés every night you stay (although, it's not much, but a nice treat), you also get free drinks (6pm-7pm) and you also get your breakfast and a welcome fruit basket!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Property”
Reviews.Author: wasagadave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped in Dubai for three nights en route to India. We were traveling for a couple of months and did not want to spend too much at our first port of call. The Arabian Park was the best value we could find in Dubai, but it did take a lot of internet searching to find the best price that included breakfast (we used hotelopia.com and got a rate of about $75/night). The buffet breakfast was well worth getting. Dining room staff could not be nicer, in fact, that was true throughout the hotel. Expect a very international mix of employees. The facilities were good: nice saltwater pool set wisely on the shady side of the building, attractive little bar (though prices here after the complimentary beverage voucher were steep), in-room lock box for small valuables (big enough for my netbook) and regular shuttle service to the airport and WAFI mall. On the down side, our room are a bit tight, but clean and comfortable. Free Internet service was not provided, but connections were available in the rooms. We generally like to be in a central location so that we can walk around a new city and soak up the feel of the place. This may not be possible in Dubai - it seems built for automobiles. The location is handy to the airport, but is otherwise isolated and lacking a pleasant view, at least on the back side. Small problems for us, and at this price, insignificant. I would not hesitate to return here and have already recommended it to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Khalid80
Reviews.Content: Whenever I have a trip to Dubai which requires sleepovers I always select to stay at the Arabian Park Hotel. The staff at the hotel are really friendly and helpful and the service they provide is are really great for a 3 star Hotel. The Hotel is located in a very quiet neighborhood so it's a great place to relax from all the raucous environment in Dubai. On the other sometimes you can't immediately find available taxis outside the hotel so you should wait for quite a while to get one. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “clean and great value.”
Reviews.Author: special23451
Reviews.Content: Close to airport but no airplane noise. Excellent and fresh breakfast with something for everyone's taste. Front desk is very accomodating to get you in your room as early as possible, if not, bag storage is convenient. I have been to Dubai 4 times in last 18 months and stayed here every time for 3-5 days. It is CONSISTENTLY spotlessly clean, always easy to get a taxi from the front door, staff is courteous (if you want someone to kiss your behind go stay at a five star hotel and pay 5 times the $). My business colleagues have left their 4 star hotels to join me here. Simply put, you just can't beat the value! The views are fair, not great, but who cares. You did not come to Dubai to sit by your window.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: Lovinmambo
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here and will definately book to stay here again. The rooms were spacious with comfy beds and we had tea/coffee making facilities as well as botteled water daily. The bathrooms were a little dated but the shower was powerful and there was plenty of hot water, the air conditioning worked really well we didnt even need it on during the night as the room kept nice and cool. We were on bed and breakfast and the breakfast and service each morning in the restaurant was excellent the staff were very efficiant, There is a nice swimming pool with plenty of sunloungers and the hotel provide pool towels. The hotel does provide a shuttle service to various locations including the airport this is probably due to the fact that the hotel is a little out of the way but taxis are cheap so getting around isnt really a issue, the dubai metro is almost complete so there will be a station opening nearby which will make getting around a little easier. The hotel charge a deposit of 100aed per night which is refunded on check-out unless you have charged any services to your room. To sum up good hotel which was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. Close to airport, ideally located to metro and major malls.”
Reviews.Author: pjandsa
Reviews.Content: The customer service is brilliant. Nice, welcoming staff at the reception. The room was nice and clean. Non carpeted rooms makes for a unique experience. Location wise, it depends on where your business meetings are going to be. Malls in close proximity include Wafi mall, Dubai festival city and Dubai mall. Easy to get to the airport after business in Dubai is ended. A newly opened metro station makes it easy to get to another part of Dubai without having to take a taxi. Free shuttle service between some of the malls/airport and the hotel at scheduled times is a definite add-on benefit. Loved the prawn tempura at the Oasis bar as well as the minestrone soup at the main restaurant. The swimming pool is on the ground floor, and is a quiet haven from the busy reception. It's definitely a busy hotel, with lots of business visitors. The business service centre is quite comfortable - I've had many business meetings there and the staff are professional and helpful. Loved the concept of referral partnership; as a guest, we were gifted with discount vouchers at the Wafi mall and restaurants as well as discounts to the Cleopatra spa, this definitely enriched the overall experience. As the hotel is situated away from busy roads and highways, it doesn't matter much what the best room view is. I definitely slept well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel lovely relaxing pool very reasonably priced food”
Reviews.Author: marilyntozer
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel, reviews I read before I went were in my opinion under rated. You will NOT get bacon and sausages for breakfast for goodness sake, but you will not go hungry, there were chicken sausages and turkey bacon (which tasted like salami), all kinds of fruit, cereals, hams and cheeses etc. staff were lovely couldn't do enough for you. Rooms were sometimes noisy very early in the morning due to furniture being moved on floor above - very annoying, but on the whole thoroughly enjoyed it. Burj Kalifa tower was an amazing feat of engineering a must see, the water/light show was addictive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: luxuryholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night post cruise before flying back to UK. Arrived hotel 09.30 and check in not until 14.00 but reception were excellent and got us into our room by 11.30. Hotel was very busy and is obviosly used mostly for stop-overs and for this purpose it is excellent as it offers free airport transfers and free tranfer to Wafi Mall. Taxis always available. Breakfast a bit frantic as it is so busy but good food and all in all unbeatable value for Dubai for a short stay. Small pool by Dubai standards but no-one in it anyway while we were there but plenty of people sunbathing.

Reviews.Title: “A good, inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom1986580405
Reviews.Content: Not one of Dubais' glorious, luxurious hotels but it's a very nice place if you're doing a quick stop over as I was (3 nights) or on business. It's quite cheap and has nice rooms, a pool, a good quality restaurant, a free shuttle bus to the nearby wafi centre, and is quite close to the airport. It is quite out the way and fairly basic compared to other places in Dubai but excellent in other regards.

Reviews.Title: “not recomend”
Reviews.Author: adhusny
Reviews.Content: bad location, bad in hotel service, regular room, bad view from the room (craves) but good & frindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimi3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Arabian Park alredy 2 times and most definitely I will be back for the 3rd.The hotel location is great-quiet but still very close ride by taxi to any good spot in Dubai.it's a 3 star hotel but the way I've been treated there is like in a 4 start hotel-absolutely amazingly friendly and helpful stuff in the whole hotel-front desk,housekeeping,restaurant,delli,pool side.Clean and well maintain rooms,with fast internet connection,free coffee tea and water,wonderful and quick room service.The restaurant is very cosy and food delicious and beautifully presented,service excellent and fast.Prices of the rooms are just GREAT.I will absolutely recommend this hotel to anybody who is traveling to Dubai either for business or leisure.Thank you Arabian park for the delightful stay which I have every time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chloe0828
Reviews.Content: I stayed with this hotel last January with my friends. I can say that the room rate is affordable and the hotel is looking good compared with other 3 star hotels in Dubai. They do also have swimming pool but the location is quite far but good thing it is near to Wafi Mall and taxis are accessible. It is just a bit creepy because from my balcony view there is a graveyard. Anyhow, the hotel staffs are very friendly and accommodating. My room was nice, spacious and the bed is so comfy....the toilet was also clean. Actually, i just booked for a standard room but they upgraded me to Superior balcony without any extra cost and that is great and very much appreciated and the rest is pretty good. I recommend this hotel and actually i am checking in again with my husband this Feb. 24, 2011 to enjoy our weekend. ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: EithneBelfast
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Dubai. Hotel was a great base. Rooms comfy and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Taxis always on hand, choice of Hotel taxis or local taxis which are slightly cheaper. Breakfast a bit expensive as ours was not included in our tariff. Also the tours organised by hotel are much more expensive than anywhere else. Desert Safari is a must!! Other tour operators can be found in local map at front desk of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kazzy20_11
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dubai for the first time last month with my husband and choose the Arabian Park hotel because of its price and positive reviews. We had done a lot of research before we travelled and was familiar with its location to all the main attractions that a tourist must visit during their stay. Although in a relatatively quiet area of the city it is close enough to all the hotspots and the cheap taxi fares to and from these destinations made it cost effective rather than staying in a more expensive, centrally based hotel. When we arrived we were not disappointed in our decision. Hotel was close to the airport but not TOO close and we were greeted with a warm friendly welcome by the reception staff. We checked into our room for the stay and it had everything we required to make our base to explore Dubai. Beds were clean, ample wardrobe space, t.v and in room tea making facilities made it homely and the view from our room out to the Burj Khalifa in the distance was a welcoming site. Didn't have to worry about transportation, hotel offered a shuttle bus service to various locations on a regular basis and if not serviced by this a taxi was never far away. We travelled to the nearby Wafi Mall and used discount vouchers offered by the hotel in various dining outlets. (Arabian Park hotel is part of the Wafi group so it transpires!) Burj Khalifa and the Dubai Mall was only 10 minutes away together with the plethora of five star hotels which line the Shiek Zayed road. At the end of the day back to the hotel for a sundowner and a splash in the pool, perfect! After making the most of our trip we left our hotel totally satisfied and content with our choice. The staff were really friendly and from our own experiences we can honestly say that for anyone who wants to visit this wonderful city and not spend a bundle on accommodation, this hotel fits the bill. We intend to return next year and do some Wadi Bashing and travel up to the mountains which we have heard are well worth the trip. We are looking forward to it already!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, you actually need a room just to sleep ;)”
Reviews.Author: mimkaBurgas
Reviews.Content: Not in the very center of the City, but has nice communications- taxi, shuttle bus, also there is a reception desk for day-excursions in Dubai and I really do advice everyone to take part in such excursion.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Billienetherlands
Reviews.Content: Hotel ok, has everything you need. Far away from things to do. Clean except for the oldfashioned shower curtains. Small but comfortabel room. Much to noisy in the night, doors slamming very loud all night and much noise from the road traffic. Price ok. One night could do, but we would not stay there for more nights. Our room overlooked the cementary. Not a nice vieuw.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible treatment to customers”
Reviews.Author: Hipa_1
Reviews.Content: Very terrible situation happened withe me in this hotel. My money was stolen form my purse in my bag when I left room that to swim in the pool. I was out only 45 minutes and really didn't expect such situation. Moreover, the administration did nothing to help me, although they confirmed that some guy entered into the my room while I was in the pool. I have terrible impression about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “awesome in everyway”
Reviews.Author: coolhand_11
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a bit out of town centre there was no problem getting around with a taxi. Hotel apartment which is quiet and upmarket with a bit more of the lively hotel less than 100m away, Excellent and awesome experiance and will stay there everytime i visit

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, excellant 3 star hotel, more like 4 star in UK”
Reviews.Author: siray11
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very big and comfy beds, very polite staff, would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: SunChaser83
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, breakfast buffet was very good. Public taxi was about 20 dhs to get to most places if you don't take the hotel shuttle. Only cons were that the shower is constantly changing from hot to cold and the beds were basic mattresses with little padding. Also, the bar is VERY smokey during busy evenings....but for the price I paid, I didn't mind these things. Great value! I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel for travellers in the Monaco of the Middle East”
Reviews.Author: blondefletch
Reviews.Content: I went to Dubai and travelled around predominantly on my own, staying in a twin bedroom room with my Dad whilst he worked. Therefore, I was in a situation where the staff knew him, and were keen to help me in anyway possible with my stay. Saying that, I never once had any impression that they were just doing it out of necessity, just that they were very keen to help. Rooms are fairly spartan, however have all you'd expect, fridge, trouser press, storage space, hangers, spacious bathroom and comfortable beds. Always immaculately cleaned too! There is a pool constantly manned by a lifeguard, a simple gym, function rooms and a cafe. The people on the reception desk and concierge were always willing to help and were always friendly and polite. The English of all the staff was good, with many open to conversation. The restaurant and buffet choices were good, however I would definitely recommend a trip to the food quarter of one of the malls if possible (not Wafi city, bit expensive) for some variety and incredible value for money. Overall, can't be faulted. Great stay, if I go back, that's where I'll shack up!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, a home from home!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul1962_10
Reviews.Content: I've reviewed this hotel before a few months back but I feel its certainly worth a mention again! I travel to Dubai on business regularly and am due back from the U.K in the next couple of days. In all I stayed at this hotel around 8 times so I feel I can give a honest appraisal judged on all my previous trips collectively. I keep returning to the Arabian Park because it has everything I need, plus more. It's location is perfect for travelling to and from Deira, Wafi City, the International Airport, Jumeira Beach and the iconic Burj Khalifa. Whether its shopping or beaches you want you'll find it all within a short taxi ride. The hotel itself has a cosy bar with ever smiling staff and a separate restuarant offering buffet breakfast, lunch and an evening meal. Quality of food is excellent and service is efficient and courteous. I still to date cannot fault it and I eat/drink there often! A Fitness room is available for those who wish to keep trim and a dunk in the large outdoor swimming pool (great for kids) can be the ideal way to finish a hard day's work/ sightseeing! Rooms are equally satisfying, extremely comfortable beds with plenty of wardrobe space for the long stay traveller. Bathrooms are a fair size with powerful showers to wash under. Hairdryers are standard, together with coffee/tea making facilities, mini fridge and a security safe. In- Room T.V has a variety of local and international channels to choose from, something for everyone can be found by flicking through the remote controls. Also a big plus point, each floor also has a central lobby area which has low tables, comfortable seating and a large plasma screen t.v for the time you want to watch that particular programme in widescreen without venturing too far!! In summary, anyone who is considering going to Dubai for a holiday or for business should seriously consider staying at this hotel. It represents excellent value for money which is welcome and proves you don't have to spend a fortune to get everything you want in this fascinating city. See you there, you won't regret it !!

Reviews.Title: “CORRECT”
Reviews.Author: Nikko63
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel and good price, but far from all the main things to do in Dubai. The lobby is very nice, we were offered a beverage at the bar inside. The outdoor pool is very close to the hotel. Nevertheless the rooms are made with poor quality materials. The windows and the walls are thin, we can hear the noise from inside the building or outside. The road is noisy. Choose a room at the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star hotel with 5 Star attitude”
Reviews.Author: Braussie
Reviews.Content: I first came to the Arabian Park back in Dec 2008, It would not have been my initial choice; being only 3 Star (Company made arrangement) but don’t be fooled, I don’t know how the ratings work in Dubai but this Hotel offers more than I find at most 4 or 5 star Hotels. I now travel regularily to Dubai and the Arabian Park is my first choice each time. It’s located in a quiet part of town yet a short taxi ride, or even courtesy bus to the City Centre, Airport and a wide spectrum of Shopping Centres.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 6 night stay”
Reviews.Author: NICOLA091
Reviews.Content: This was a very last minute trip with my son, who was in Dubai on business. The hotel was exactly as described and I had a very relaxed stay - it is not 7 star, but does provide a very good level of service and the room was very comfortable. It is outside th city bussle but free transport is provided to the nearest Mall, as well as some other locations, including the beach. It is also very well placed for the airport. Once the second Metro line is completed there will be a stop quite close by.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprized......”
Reviews.Author: LadyJMidlands
Reviews.Content: As with some of the more positive reviews on here I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Yes it is slightly out of the centre but in Dubai you are never close to everything. I stayed here for 4 nights as I needed a cheapish break in the sun. The hotel is not far from the airport, approx 40 dirhams including tip. But the airport taxis charge 20 dirhams even before you go anywhere so that shows you how close it is. The hotel does do a good shuttle service to the airport but it does not pick up from terminal 3 (only 1) although it does drop off there. Hopefully that may change in the future. The hotel was pretty busy but after a couple of hours wait by the pool I was checked in well before the 2pm check in time which was great. My room was very clean and adequate for myself and it had a nice view of the Dubai skyline. I slept really well as the bed was comfy (better than home) There is a lounge area on each floor with free newspapers and a large tv which is really nice and gives a good feel about the place. The free shuttle bus to the beach leaves at 8.30am and 1pm returning at 1.30pm and 5.30pm. It takes about 10-15 mins depending on traffic. I got a taxi back one day and it cost 28 dirhams which is nothing really for a great day at the Jumeriah Beach Park. There are frequent free shuttle buses to the Wafi Mall which is a really nice place and makes a change from the Dubai and Emirates Mall. On check in at the hotel I was given some vouchers for discounts off various places to eat at Wafi and they do come in useful and reduce your bill somewhat. There is also a Carrefour Express just outside the mall where you can stock up on snacks and drinks as although there is a 24 hour snack bar/deli at the hotel there are no shops nearby. I did visit the Dubai Mall (again) and got the hotel taxi which does cost more. But at 25 dirhams to arrive in a posh car it was well worth it and a normal taxi back it cost 15 dirhams plus a tip. So you are quite near to the Dubai mall if you don't fancy the Wafi. I didn't eat at the hotel but the food looked nice and wasn't too expensive and the bar had sport/football on when I passed through so it was a nice place to have a drink and catch up on the results (if you like sport that is). Or you can sit outside by the pool instead which was very relaxing. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very nice and not forced as you sometimes find at other hotels. The only downside was that the pool does not get much sun in the day, only a couple of hours in the morning. But not everyone likes the sun baking on them so for the sun worshippers like me the beach park was not too far away to relax by the sea. Sorry if I have gone on a bit but I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I have stayed in a couple of 5* hotels before in Dubai but I couldn't afford to do it again this year so I opted for this hotel and I will most certainly stay there again. If you want to be pampered and chocolates put on your pillow at night then this will not be for you. But if you just want a nice, clean and comfortable base to explore Dubai or hit the beach without remortgaging your house then try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: jmcn5195
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very average but for the price I wasn't expecting anything great. I didn't eat in the restaurant or use the pool so I can't comment on those. The room service food was decent though and the little store selling drinks and snacks was open 24 hours a day which was nice. My room was pretty small the view was not good. I barely had enough room to place my laptop on the table because of the tv and other items. Felt really cramped. The hotel is also really far from Jumeirah (about 30 minutes and 50 Dirhams for the taxi) and about 15-20 minutes from the Dubai Mall (taxi was about 15-20 Dirhams). That was a little inconvenient for me and the hotel charges you 75 Dirhams a day for internet service in your room. The money I thought I was saving was quickly spent on taxis and internet. The tv in your room only gets very basic cable with about 20 channels only 4 of which I actually watched. They do not give out newspapers for each room every morning either. Just felt really cheap and that they really pinch pennies. Overall it was not terribly expensive for Dubai (less than $90 USD a night) and it is kept pretty neat. I would probably not stay there on my next visit to Dubai though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kala_Mata_2010
Reviews.Content: If you're not looking to spend a disgusting amount of money for your accommodations in Dubai, then the Arabain Park Hotel is a perfect choice. Great value for money. The location is strange at first - the hotel seems to be on its own in the middle of nowhere, but realistically, it's only a few minutes' taxi ride from wherever you want to go. Better yet is the fact that the hotel offers a shuttle service that runs at various times throughout the day to the nearby WAFI shopping centre, as well as the airport (with service back to the hotel). The rooms are fairly plain, but are comfortable and very clean. The hotel also has common areas on each floor where you can hang out, read, watch TV, etc. They also have a business centre with computers that you can use (for a fee), as well as a nice lounge on the main floor. The included breakfast is a very nice addition, and there is a wide enough variety of food to satisfy most tastes. The staff we dealt with were all very friendly and extremely helpful - no complaints there. All in all, GREAT hotel. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: etees
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an enjoyable three day stop over in Dubai recently where we stayed at the Arabian park Hotel. From the moment we walked through the door on our arrival we were treated to first class service at the reception desk and this was the standard of service through out our stay. The room that we had suited our purposes perfectly and was very clean and well maintained and so quiet. When ever we arrived at the reception area we were helped with any queries that we had and assisted with a taxi if we wished to go anywhere. This was always done quickly and with a smile everytime. When ever we saw any of the staff we were always greeted appropriately and with a smile. You can't beat this hotel for value for money either. If you are a woman travelling in Dubai you are always treated with respect and have nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit This Year ,Returning In December,Says It All!”
Reviews.Author: Geordie1963
Reviews.Content: Listen if you want a beach hotel thats fine pay 250+ per night,if you want 5 star luxury thats also fine pay 200+ per night,or if you wish to have all you need in comfortable surroundings with most facilities at incredible value, look no further than this establishment for 5 star value and service.We have been holidaying in Dubai for over 14 years now and have stayed in many different hotels and as more and more open the choice is vast, that is 4/5 star and 2 star billy basic in the city centre,what they have failed to recognise is something inbetween, this is where the Arbian Park comes into its own and wins hands down.We found this hotel in 2008 and have returned year on year,it use to be mainly business people but as word has got out more and more tourists are now staying from all over the world ,a high percentagecoming from Europe . Even if you do not drive a hire car here to get about,what you will save on room cost will cover you for cheap taxis, meals and more,everything is within easy reach,Mall of the Emirates 20 mins.beach 15 mins,Outlet Mall 15 mins, Dubai Mall 10 mins, Deira city centre 10 mins,Wafi Centre, Karama and Festival City all only 5 mins away nothing could be easier. Think carefully what you want in Dubai as this hotel i have said in an earlier review Ticks ALL my boxes.ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Like and Don't”
Reviews.Author: anna_pallanga
Reviews.Content: I LIKE the the service and cleanliness of your hotel and also the room rates is affordable. But I DON'T LIKE the way your housekeeping clean the empty rooms as they used to bang the door it may disturb to the other guest next room. Location is bit far from shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest hotels I have been to.”
Reviews.Author: ATTIA786
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome, the staffs are very friendly. They provide a lot of help with your luggage when you come in the hotel or when to leave. We liked the idea of providing free shuttle bus which takes you to different places and to drop us to the airport. We also enjoyed the swimming pool area and the breakfast buffet had a lot of variety. Overall we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Paul1962_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on three seperate occassions now and would 100% recommend to other travellers who want good quality accomodation for a reasonable price. The staff are always welcoming and courteous which makes your stay even more enjoyable. Location is excellent if you wish to visit the creek, Diera city centre and Wafi Malls and it's close to the airport too, but not too close that you can hear it!! I am returning in September for a months stay and am pleased to have found a hotel in Dubai that is fully up to my expectations. Well done Arabian Park and your team!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Sandyduke
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I have to say that I booked a one night stay through the Octopus travel site and got an extremely good price. With that in mind, I went thinking that I should not expect too much. Fortunately, I was very pleasantly surprised. Whilst the outside of the hotel looks a little drab, inside everything appears new. My room was clean and comfortable and had everything I required, tea and coffee included. Very pleasant lounge / tv rooms on every floor ( there is tv in the room also) and service was generally very good. The restaurant food was also of a good standard. This hotel is slightly out of Dubai central, but they do provide a free shuttle bus to Wafi Mall, Jumeirah and Dubai Mall (Burj Khalifa). Also free airport shuttle is available but on a timetable, so if your flight schedule doesn't coincide a taxi is required, which costs around DHS 25 (about £5). As most of my trips to Dubai are short, I would definitely look at staying here again. Because of its location I am not sure if I would stay for more than a couple of days. Having said that, if you are looking for a good value "budget" option, then this may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: kayedamman
Reviews.Content: me and my family in jordan amman chose to go in a vication to dubai for its good weather at that time , so i booked 2 suites in this hotel in january 2010 and they were amazing !. rooms are big with comfortable beds and high water pressure in their bathroom , breakfast was delecious with wide range of choises (perfect) , swimming pool was kinda big but cold ! , however me and the rest of the family enjoyed swimming in it , sice we rented a car ...i liked the free parking .......simply a very beautiful hotel in the middle of dubai :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place, clean and easy connections everywhere”
Reviews.Author: lorus57
Reviews.Content: It is second time that I and my colleges choose this hotel. It is really quite, clean and even it is not in the most populated areas the free shuttle bus helps to catch airport, Wafi Hotel, Museum and the beach. I enjoyed a very pleasant stay with my colleges there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Top-Hat
Reviews.Content: Arabian Park is a relatively new hotel, with rooms decorated in a modern theme. Room size ranges from reasonable to spacious (I was upgraded in one of my many stays) The balcony in the higher grade rooms are very nice. However, each floor has a vast lounge with a common balcony. Depending on which side your room/balcony faces you might get some great day/night views of the Dubai cityscape. Cleanliness and service were always top notch. My requests for ice (since the mini bar wasn't really providing much refrigeration) from room service were always provided with a smile, and free of charge. One small issue in the bathrooms is the lack of curtain or full size splash guard. The whole bathroom tends to get soaked after a shower. I appreciated the complimentary in-room tea and coffee. However, free internet (in this day and age) really should be a standard service (it wasn't here!) The location of the hotel can be a bit frustrating. Although not far from most destinations in the city, it is slightly isolated. This isn't an issue if you have a car, and taxis are most of the time available at the door. However, your cab driver might find it a tad difficult to get there the first time. This isolation, on the other hand, and the fact that there is not a night club on premise, allows for a quiet sleep. Something that should not be taken for granted in most Dubai city hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Dubai for One Night”
Reviews.Author: Meripino
Reviews.Content: The Arabian Park Hotel is everything you need for a short stay. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast was amazing with beautiful fresh produce and other goodies too numerous to mention. Their restaurant was very good also, but check that your credit card has accidentally been double charged. Our room was comfortable with adequate room, although the view of wasteland was less than lovely. The surrounds of this hotel are not very glamorous and there are no gardens to speak of, but there is a pool which looked perfect for a dip and a very good bar just leading from the pool. Taxis are plentiful if you wish to see other parts of Dubai and they have a very efficient shuttle service. All up we found this hotel to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “More of a business place”
Reviews.Author: scorch6744
Reviews.Content: The reason I chose to stay here is becaues I got a cheap deal (hotel definitely wasn't close to full) and I saw they had shuttles to the airport, mall, dubai museum, and Jumeirah beach. My choice was between here and the Golden Sands Hotel apartments and I kind of wish I had stayed at Golden Sands. I would recommend something else for tourists. I was visiting Dubai on a 5 day break from studying abroad in South Africa so my main purpose was tourism/sight seeing that kind of thing. This is definitely a hotel that caters to the business traveler who can charge all his meals to the company credit card. I didn't buy a single item of food at the hotel despite them having a deli and restaurant because the prices were just rediculous. Roughly $10 US for a pre-made sandwich? I'll pass. They also have a 'no food from outside' policy but I just brought in granola bars in stuff in my backpack to eat for breakfast. The shuttles were nice, but the ones to and from Dubai Museum and Jumeirah beach only run once or twice a day respectively which kind of limits your itinerary if you wanna use that. The hotel itself isn't really in Bur Dubai, its right outside in Jadaf. It was about a ten minute trip into central Bur Dubai depending on traffic and taking the nice modern public bus to the Khalid bin Waleed Metro station was a pretty convenient way to access the city without splurging for cabs every time. Metro closes around 10:30 though so if your planning to go out at night you'll have to get a cab, but they are pretty cheap by western standards. However, when the green metro line opens up in the next year or so this place is going to be really convenient to access the metro. You can see them building the station about a five minute walk away and that will make getting most places you'd want to see in the city pretty easy. The hotel staff were generally friendly, but not really that helpful. The concierge was the absolute worst, he wasn't friendly and frankly he just struck me as really incompetant. They only had city maps in arabic so I asked him to mark down some things for me so I could find them myself and wouldn't do it. He just told me to wait until the next day to take the shuttle to the Dubai museum and then just ask the driver. Thanks for not doing your job. I also booked a desert safari tour on my own and he got kind of pissed off at me that I didn't do it through him (probably because he didn't get a commission that way) and told me that because I didn't do it through him the tour wouldnt come and that I should just go back to my room. The tour people came in the next five minutes. Overall the guy was just unhelpful, incompetant, and kind of rude. Gym was pretty small and half of the one multi function nautilus machine was broken. Internet was pretty expensive. Overall this place I'd think is good for business travelers just in town for a few days as it's in a quiet location and the rooms are comfortable and good for sleeping. For tourists stay somewhere more central and either self catering or with affordable meal options.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Nijh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night prior to a cruise. Arriving around 2am the check in was quick and efficient with a porter available to take luggage if required. The staff were friendly and welcoming and certainly gave a great first impression. Breakfast was OK but if I was staying longer I'd try to find somewhere else; pastries were good, but the hot food left a little to be desired - the curried potato pasty was a bit weird and I won't get used to turkey bacon! The public rooms were all clean, bright and airy. The bedroom was comfortable enough and the complimentary bottled water that was in there was most welcome. Free shuttle buses were available to the airport, beach and airport and they were timely and reliable. WAFI mall was 7 minutes away, the airport about 15. I’d stay here again for a layover without a second thought, but if you wanted to stay here for the duration of a holiday then it’s a bit far out from the Dubai you’d want to see – but taxis are cheap and plentiful, so you pay your money and make your choice on that one.

Reviews.Title: “Calm out of chaos”
Reviews.Author: larocan
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 19th April knowing that the UK airports were shut. It seemed chaos on arrival at the hotel. However within 2 hours our coachload were all allocated rooms. No mean feat! Mark Lee the manager was very helpful.We had to stay an extra night and it was no problem to keep our rooms and the rate was reduced. When we got an urgent call at 7am to be at the airport as soon as possible he laid on a bus for us, as our tour operator could not be contacted. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Volcano Adventure”
Reviews.Author: joethurley1
Reviews.Content: Had one night booked following a cruise, ended up staying 4 nights / 5 days due to the volcano. Pay the extra for a room with a balcony, worth every penny.Hotel and rooms are spotless. Swimming pool is cleaned daily,when the hotel is full you need to be up at 7am to get a sun bed. Staff are very friendly and very accommodating,we had to check out 3 times to try and get stand by flights but they kept our room for every time we returned ! Forget the free shuttle to the WAFI mall,it's rubbish. Order a taxi,takes 10 mins to arrive and pay £4 to the Dubai Mall,so much more to see and the food is good value and so much choice .Yes there are much better hotels in Dubai 6* and 7* but you will not find better value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Unusal circumstances - Ash trip”
Reviews.Author: Ferg21
Reviews.Content: On my way back from a conference in Doha - unexpectedly held over here for 6 days due to Iceland vocalno, so not expecting much, as Emirates airline paid for all. That said, the staff were great, although under a fair bit of pressure given the circumstances and the hotel was chock-a-block. General Manager - Mark Lee was excellent in communicating to all guests.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STANDARDS IN DUBAI”
Reviews.Author: elaine16660
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel situated in the heart of Dubai and central for all your needs. The room was spacious, clean and very well appointed. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The pool is an oasis in the heart of Dubai, very relaxing and very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of Nowhere”
Reviews.Author: wh2912
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it was close to the Airport, but there was construction work going on around the hotel.
